resources.string: Share image with scrambled Exif via
Share images with scrambled Exif via
Request permission
Scrambled Exif needs access to your files to read the images you share with it.\n\nPlease tap on the button below to grant the necessary permission.
Instructions
Select the pictures you wish to share from your gallery and tap on the share icon.
Select Scrambled Exif from the app list.
At this point, the metadata is being deleted!
Once this is done, the app list appears again. Just share the pictures like you normally would.
Et voil√†! You just shared some pictures without metadata with the world!
Scrambled Exif needs file access. Please open the app and grant it from there
Couldn\'t find any images to scramble.
Couldn\'t scramble "%s" because it is not a JPEG image.
Privacy Policy
Scrambled Exif Privacy Policy

This privacy policy governs your use of the software application Scrambled Eggsif for mobile devices that was created by juanitobananas (Juan Garc√≠a Basilio).

This privacy policy is possibly, though not probably, outdated. The newest privacy policy is available here.

Data collected by me

I, that is, the app developer, do not collect any personal information whatsoever.

Data collected by Google Play (only applies if downloaded from Google Play Store)

Google Inc. provides the developer, i.e. me, with anonymised user data (aggregate data) through the Google Play Developer Console.

If you review the app Google Inc. will additionally provide information about your device (Device, Manufacturer, Device type, Device language, CPU make, CPU model, Native platform, RAM (MB), Screen size, Screen density (dpi), OpenGL ES version and OS).

Please refer to the Google Play Store Privacy Policy (https://play.google.com/about/privacy-security/) for more information on how Google Inc. handles your data.

Data collected by F-Droid (only applies if downloaded from F-Droid)

As far as I know, F-Droid Limited does not collect any personal information whatsoever.

Please refer to the F-Droid web page (https://f-droid.org/about/) for more information.

Email communication

If you contact me per email, I will exclusively use your contact data to process your inquiry.

Please feel free to contact me, e.g. per email (juam+scrambled@posteo.net), if you want me to delete your data.
Settings
Force image rewrite
This option forces rewriting the whole image file (normally only the EXIF data is removed).\n\nThis option makes removing EXIF data slower but safer, and could have an influence in picture quality.
Rename images
Filenames can tell a recipient of the file the date and time that a photo was taken on some devices.\n\nThis option renames all shared images with a random filename.
Keep orientation
This \"physically\" rotates the image according to the EXIF data in the original image.\n\nThe image needs to re-written, which means it takes a little longer and implies (probable) quality loss.
Logging
Enable logging
Write logs to app\'s cache directory. On non-rooted devices, only Scrambled Exif should be able to access these logs. You can send them to the dev using the option below.
Send logs to dev
Perhaps he\'ll be able to help :)
Panic Button
With the following settings you can configure how Scrambled Exif reacts to an external panic button app (e.g. Ripple) trigger.
Clear app data
Delete cached images and settings.
